briefdescription.para: Internal map type for GameObject storage.
Lazy range type for component-filtered GameObject iteration.

detaileddescription.para: This alias wraps GameObjectView with the appropriate map and component types. The view filters GameObjects on-the-fly during iteration, yielding only those that possess all specified component types.

simplesect.para: GameObjectView is included as a .h header in the global module fragment due to MSVC ICE issues when used as a .ixx module interface unit.

parameterdescription.para: The map type (const or non-const).
The component types to filter by.

briefdescription.para: Hash map storing all active GameObjects, indexed by their Guid.

detaileddescription.para: Uses `std::unordered_map` for amortized O(1) average-case lookup. The map owns all GameObjects via `std::unique_ptr`. Worst-case lookup is O(n) in case of hash collisions, but the sequential Guid generation ensures good hash distribution in practice.

briefdescription.para: Collection of registered Manager instances.

detaileddescription.para: Managers handle cross-cutting concerns such as object pooling, spawn management, and projectile lifecycle. They are initialized via init() and flushed each frame via flushManagers().

briefdescription.para: The current level loaded in the game world.

detaileddescription.para: Can be null if no level is currently active.

briefdescription.para: Registry mapping pool IDs to their request handlers.

detaileddescription.para: Request handlers process spawn/despawn requests for specific pools, enabling custom lifecycle management per pool type.

briefdescription.para: The logger used with this GameWorld instance.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults to HELIOS_LOG_SCOPE.

briefdescription.para: Initializes all registered managers.

detaileddescription.para: Should be called after all managers have been added and before the game loop starts. Each manager's init() method is invoked with a reference to this GameWorld.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current level for the game world.

parameterdescription.para: Unique pointer to the Level instance. Ownership is transferred to the GameWorld.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a level is currently loaded.

simplesect.para: True if a level is set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the currently loaded level.

simplesect.para: Reference to the active Level.
Calling this method when hasLevel() returns false results in undefined behavior.

briefdescription.para: Checks if a Manager of the specified type is registered.

parameterdescription.para: The Manager type to check for.

simplesect.para: True if a Manager of type T is registered, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds and registers a Manager of the specified type.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new Manager instance and adds it to the world. The manager's onAdd() callback is invoked after registration.

parameterdescription.para: The Manager type to add. Must derive from Manager.
Constructor argument types.
Arguments forwarded to the Manager constructor.

simplesect.para: Reference to the newly added Manager.
No Manager of type T is already registered.

briefdescription.para: Registers a SpawnRequestHandler for a specific spawn profile.

detaileddescription.para: Associates a handler with a spawn profile ID. The handler processes spawn and despawn requests for entities associated with that profile.

parameterdescription.para: The spawn profile identifier to associate with the handler.
Reference to the handler to register.

simplesect.para: True if registration succeeded, false if already registered.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a SpawnRequestHandler for a specific spawn profile.

detaileddescription.para: Used to submit spawn/despawn requests to the handler responsible for a particular spawn profile (e.g., bullet pool, enemy pool).

parameterdescription.para: The spawn profile identifier to look up.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the handler, or nullptr if not registered.
SpawnRequestHandler

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a registered Manager by type.

parameterdescription.para: The Manager type to retrieve. Must derive from Manager.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the Manager if found, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Flushes all registered managers.

detaileddescription.para: Called during the game loop to allow managers to process their queued requests (e.g., spawn requests, pool returns).

parameterdescription.para: The current frame's update context.

briefdescription.para: Adds a GameObject to the world and transfers ownership.

parameterdescription.para: The GameObject to add. Ownership is transferred to the GameWorld.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the added GameObject, or nullptr if addition failed.

parameterdescription.para: Non-owning pointer to the added object (valid until removed)
If gameObject was null or a GameObject with the same Guid already exists

simplesect.para: The GameWorld takes ownership of the GameObject. The returned pointer remains valid until the GameObject is removed from the world.
Attempting to add a nullptr or a GameObject with a duplicate Guid will fail, return nullptr, and log a warning.

briefdescription.para: Finds a GameObject by its unique identifier.

parameterdescription.para: The unique identifier of the GameObject to find.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the GameObject if found, nullptr otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Non-owning pointer to the found object
If no GameObject with the specified Guid exists

simplesect.para: This is the non-const overload. Use the const overload for read-only access.

briefdescription.para: Finds all GameObjects that have the specified component types.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a lazy range that filters GameObjects on-the-fly during iteration. Only GameObjects possessing all specified component types are yielded.
The query is controlled by a `GameObjectFilter` bitmask:

| Filter | Effect | |--------|--------| | `Active` | Only `obj->isActive() == true` | | `Inactive` | Only `obj->isActive() == false` | | `ComponentEnabled` | Only objects where queried components are enabled | | `ComponentDisabled` | Only objects where queried components are disabled |
Filters can be combined: `Active | ComponentEnabled` (default).

Example usage: ```cpp // Range-based for loop with default filter (Active + ComponentEnabled) for (auto* obj : gameWorld.find<Move2DComponent, SceneNodeComponent>()) { auto* move = obj->get<Move2DComponent>(); move->setVelocity({1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}); }
// Using each() for direct component access (structured bindings) for (auto [obj, move] : gameWorld.find<Move2DComponent>().each()) { move.get().setVelocity({1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}); }
// Custom filter: find inactive objects for (auto* obj : gameWorld.find<HealthComponent>(GameObjectFilter::Inactive)) { // Process inactive entities (e.g., respawn logic) } ```

parameterdescription.para: The component types to filter by. GameObjects must have all types.
Filter bitmask controlling which entities are included. Default: `Active | ComponentEnabled`.

simplesect.para: A GameObjectView object that can be iterated over.
GameObjectFilter
GameObjectView

briefdescription.para: Finds all GameObjects that have the specified component types (const overload).

detaileddescription.para: Const version of the component-based find. Returns const pointers to GameObjects. See the non-const overload for detailed usage and filter documentation.

parameterdescription.para: The component types to filter by. GameObjects must have all types.
Filter bitmask controlling which entities are included. Default: `Active | ComponentEnabled`.

simplesect.para: A const GameObjectView object that can be iterated over.
GameObjectFilter

briefdescription.para: Finds a GameObject by its unique identifier (const overload).

parameterdescription.para: The unique identifier of the GameObject to find.

simplesect.para: Const pointer to the GameObject if found, nullptr otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: GameObject* Non-owning const pointer to the found object
If no GameObject with the specified Guid exists

simplesect.para: This overload is used when the GameWorld is accessed via const reference.

briefdescription.para: Creates a clone of an existing GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: Clones all Cloneable components from the source GameObject. The cloned GameObject is initially inactive and receives a new Guid. Non-cloneable components are skipped with a warning.

parameterdescription.para: The source GameObject to clone.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created clone, or nullptr on failure.
The clone is added to the world in an inactive state.

xrefdescription.para: Optional ClonePolicy where rules are specified?

briefdescription.para: Removes a GameObject from the world and transfers ownership to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: Reference to the GameObject to remove.

simplesect.para: Unique pointer to the removed GameObject, or nullptr if not found.

parameterdescription.para: Ownership of the removed object
If the GameObject was not found in the world

simplesect.para: After successful removal, all non-owning pointers to the GameObject become invalid unless the caller maintains the returned unique_ptr.
Attempting to remove a GameObject that doesn't exist returns nullptr and logs a warning.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a const ref to the map of all active GameObjects.

simplesect.para: A const reference to the internal map of GameObjects, indexed by Guid.
Modifying the map directly (e.g. adding/removing elements) bypasses GameWorld's management logic and should be avoided. Use addGameObject() and removeGameObject() instead.

briefdescription.para: Central registry for game entities, managers, pools, and the active level.

detaileddescription.para: The GameWorld is the root container for the game state. It manages the lifecycle of GameObjects, coordinates Managers, and holds the current Level.
## Key Responsibilities

listitem.para: **Entity Management:** Owns all GameObjects and provides amortized O(1) lookup by Guid via `std::unordered_map`.
**Component Queries:** Efficient iteration over GameObjects with specific components via `find<Components...>()` with optional filtering by active/enabled state.
**Pool Management:** Registers and provides access to GameObjectPools for entity recycling.
**Manager Coordination:** Holds Managers that handle cross-cutting concerns (spawning, projectile pooling) and flushes them each frame.
**Level Management:** Holds the active Level instance with arena bounds.

detaileddescription.para: ## Usage with GameLoop
The GameWorld is passed to Systems via UpdateContext. Systems query GameObjects and their components, while mutations are typically performed through Commands that are flushed by the CommandBuffer.
```cpp // In a System void update(UpdateContext& ctx) noexcept override { for (auto [obj, move] : ctx.gameWorld().find<Move2DComponent>().each()) { // Process entities with Move2DComponent } } ```
## Filtering
The `find()` methods accept a `GameObjectFilter` bitmask to control which entities are returned:
Default filter is `Active | ComponentEnabled`.

simplesect.para: GameObject
GameObjectFilter
